page.title: 02Scorton village today
page.content: Scorton is a rural community of about 500 people,including the villagers and the surrounding farms.Residents include retired people,families with children and some short_term residents,mainly university students.There is a wide age_range and no predominant age group.The village has 3 churches,St.Peter's C.ofE. Parish Church;St.Mary's and St.James R.C.church;and the Wesleyan Methodist chapel.St.Peter's has a voluntary aided school,with over 40 pupils on roll.For a small community Scorton is well provided with social facilities,having a bowling club,tennis club and a Women's Institute.The Public Hall is used for flower arranging classes and old tyme dancing and is also available for private functions.
